CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In addition , the increased amount of TPD caused the appearance of a new absorption band around 500- 600 nm , which can be attributed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) band from BDTT to TPD.

Let's think step by step.

1. TPD: Thiophene-based Polymer Derivative
2. BDTT: Bathocuproine Disulfonic Acid (or Bathophenanthroline Disulfonic Acid)

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are TPD and BDTT.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

The increased amount of TPD caused the appearance of a new absorption band around 500-600 nm, which can be attributed to the intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) band from BDTT to TPD.

Material Name entities:
1. TPD: Thiophene-based Polymer Derivative.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Thiophene-based Polymer Derivative (TPD) |
| Bathocuproine Disulfonic Acid (BDTT) |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In addition , the increased amount of TPD caused the appearance of a new absorption band around 500- 600 nm , which can be attributed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) band from BDTT to TPD.

Let's think step by step.

1. TPD: Thiophene-linked Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene)
2. BDTT: Bathocuproine Disulfonic Acid
3. ICT: Intramolecular Charge Transfer
4. nm: Nanometer (unit of length)
5. absorption band: A spectral feature in the absorption spectrum of a material, indicating the wavelengths of light that are absorbed by the material.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. TPD: Thiophene-linked Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene)
2. absorption band: A spectral feature in the absorption spectrum of a material, indicating the wavelengths of light that are absorbed by the material.

These are the material properties mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Thiophene-linked Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) (TPD) |
| absorption band |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In addition , the increased amount of TPD caused the appearance of a new absorption band around 500- 600 nm , which can be attributed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) band from BDTT to TPD.

Let's think step by step.

1. TPD: Thiophene-linked Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) (an organic semiconductor)
2. BDTT: Bathocuproine-5,5'-disulfonic acid (an organic compound used as an electron acceptor)
3. 500-600 nm: Wavelength range of the new absorption band
4. ICT: Intramolecular charge transfer (a process where an electron is transferred within a molecule)
5. 5,5'-disulfonic acid: A functional group present in Bathocuproine-5,5'-disulfonic acid.

So, the property values in the paragraph are:

1. TPD
2. BDTT
3. 500-600 nm
4. ICT
5. 5,5'-disulfonic acid.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. TPD: Thiophene-linked Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) (optical property: new absorption band around 500-600 nm)
2. 500-600 nm: Wavelength range of the new absorption band (optical property).

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Thiophene-linked Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) (new absorption band around 500-600 nm) |
| Wavelength range of the new absorption band (500-600 nm) |
